review: I bought this device to wirelessly send content from my laptop to the TV.  It works fairly well with Windows 7 or on my Android tablet, but will NOT work with both.  That is to say, the Chromecast can be configured to work with the Win7 laptop and then the Android tablet will not work.  Or, you can configure the Android tablet to work but then the Win7 laptop will not work.  Also, if you read the description on Amazon VERY CAREFULLY you will discover there is no claim made that the Android chrome browser will work with the Chromecast.  Thus, 1 star from me.

review: Missing featuresWired network connection. This is a streaming device, needs stable network connection.Support for 5GHz wifi.Support for hidden networks.Turn off control light. It is annoying to see it behind the tv, especially when it's blinking.It does well what it supports. YouTube and Google Play work without any problem in the UK.Chrome plugin now has experimental screencast (20 November 2013). It is working but needs a little more work, i.e. to fit the screen because now top and bottom are not visible. This is not casting a tab, it is mirroring the entire computer screen and only works on computers yet.It is not switching on Panasonic Viera TX-L42B6B TV. It's not switching inputs either.I don't know if this is a software issue in Chromecast or an issue with the TV. The TV does switch to other HDMI sources automatically.YouTube play settings like Annotations, speed and quality are not applied to Chromecast when selected in Chrome browser on a laptop.It seems it always tries to play the highest quality what makes some videos not play because connection speed is too slow for HD quality and never stops buffering.I had many issues connecting Chromecast to my wifi network. After spending long time with trying out different settings I found the issue was that router was set to use a specific channel and for some reason Chromecast couldn't see that channel (I think it was 12). It worked with another channel though.Update 23 November 2013It seems there was a software update (definitely to the Android app) and now all available wireless networks are listed in app including hidden ones and hidden can be set to Chromecast and it works with it. Hooray.
